ccre.net

Class ConnectionReceiverThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ccre.concurrency.ReporterThread
        • ccre.net.ConnectionReceiverThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CluckTCPServer

    public abstract class ConnectionReceiverThread
extends ReporterThread
    A simple thread to allow easy writing of servers without creating a custom thread to receive new client connections.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionReceiverThread

        public ConnectionReceiverThread(java.lang.String name,
                                int port)
        Create a new ConnectionReceiverThread with the specified thread name and port.
        Parameters:
        name - The thread name. This is passed directly to ReporterThread.
        port - This is the TCP port to host on.

    • Method Detail

      • threadBody

        protected final void threadBody()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: ReporterThread
        The body of the thread. This will be called when the thread starts. This is guaranteed to be called precisely once by the ReporterThread.
        Specified by:
        threadBody in class ReporterThread
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • handleClient

        protected abstract void handleClient(ClientSocket conn)
                              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Handle a client. This is ran in a new thread, so you don't need to worry about holding up other threads or accidentally terminating all connections if an error occurs. The connection will be closed automatically once this method returns or throws an error.
        Parameters:
        conn - The client connection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - If something bad happens.
